citation.article-title: Haloterrigena salina sp. nov., an extremely halophilic archaeon isolated from a salt lake.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Haloterrigena salina sp. nov.
Haloterrigena salina (sa.li′na. L. fem. adj. salina salted, saline).
Cells are non-motile and coccoid, occurring in pairs or irregular clusters, 1.2–1.6 μm in diameter (Fig. 1), and Gram-negative.
Colonies are circular, smooth, entire, opaque and light-red pigmented, 0.2 mm in diameter after 7 days at 37 °C on plates containing 20 % (w/v) total salts.
Extremely halophilic.
Growth occurs at NaCl concentrations of 2.5–5.0 M, at pH 6.0–9.0 and at 25–50 °C.
The optimal NaCl concentration, pH and temperature for growth are 3.4 M, pH 7.0–8.0 and 37 °C.
MgCl2 is not required for growth.
Chemo-organotrophic, aerobic and oxidase- and catalase-positive.
Indole is not produced from tryptophan.
Methyl red, Voges–Proskauer and Simmons' citrate tests are negative.
Acid is not produced from lactose, glycerol, d-glucose, sucrose, d-fructose, d-arabinose, maltose, d-galactose, trehalose or d-mannose.
Does not grow anaerobically in the presence of nitrate or l-arginine.
Aesculin is hydrolysed.
Starch, gelatin, DNA, urea and casein are not hydrolysed.
Does not produce arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase or ornithine decarboxylase.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite; gas is not produced from nitrite.

The following substrates are utilized as sole carbon and energy sources: d-arabinose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, lactose, maltose, d-mannose, starch, d-xylose, aspartic acid, acetate, glutamate and threonine.
No growth is observed on d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, trehalose, raffinose, succinate or malate.

Resistant to ampicillin (10 μg), chloramphenicol (30 μg), erythromycin (15 μg), gentamicin (10 μg), nalidixic acid (30 μg), neomycin (10 μg), penicillin G (10 U), streptomycin (10 μg) and tetracycline (30 μg).
Major polar lipids are C20C20 and C20C25 derivatives of PG, PGP-Me and S2-DGD.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 67.0 mol% (Tm).
The type strain, strain XH-65T (=CGMCC 1.6203T =JCM 13891T), was isolated from the saline Lake Xilinhot in Inner Mongolia, PR China.
